definition: seven-year itch
seven/7
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to itch/to tickle

sentences.english: Is there so-called the seven year itch between two friends?
sentences.chinese: 朋友之間有沒有所謂的“七年之癢”呢？

sentences.english: But couples who manage to survive the seven-year itch would be wise not to get complacent。
sentences.chinese: 但成功度過“七年之癢”的夫婦不要沾沾自喜。

sentences.english: I think I have just opened the floodgate.
sentences.chinese: 我想，七年之癢已經開始奏效了。

definition: loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love/to fall in love with sb else
past tense
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
see 婚外情[hun1 wai4 qing2]
to die peacefully/(fig.) to result in failure (without any outside interference)/to come to nothing/to fizzle out
to force someone to do something
monodrama/one-man show/comic talk
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
